cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 720 mi SE of Bermuda and 580 mi NE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW and accelerate, tracking across the southwest Atlantic toward the North-South Carolina coast, then drifting inland across the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina/South Carolina coast (near Cape Fear – Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and mid-Atlantic U.S. coastline from northern Florida through North Carolina and Virginia
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Michigan/Great‐Lakes site listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (remnant rain band could reach 1–3 inches)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible if remnants pass nearby, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds not expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (fresh-water river/lake system, far inland from ocean surge)
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for moderate rainfall from remnant moisture late week; localized flooding in low-lying areas is the main concern
weather_observation.other_hazards: River/urban flooding if heavy rain bands pivot north of the Appalachians toward the Great Lakes
